## Description {#details}

A <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystream">BinaryStream</a> which can be read from as well as written to.

Note that writing to a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/binarystream">BinaryStream</a> always necessitates copying from the input buffer to the stream&#39;s backing store. Streams are assumed to be buffered so that to be portable it is necessary to call <a href="#addf522a96d8130e76dd777fbe0b32ec3">commit()</a> on the stream when all data has been written.

Definition at line 72 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystream-h">BinaryStream.h</a>.

### writeBytes() {#a815a7df4e61a61d9ef36e21867f17fe4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>virtual Error llvm::WritableBinaryStream::writeBytes (uint64&#95;t Offset, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt; uint8&#95;t &gt; Data)</>}>
Attempt to write the given bytes into the stream at the desired offset.

This will always necessitate a copy. Cannot shrink or grow the stream, only writes into existing allocated space.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystream-h/#l00079">79</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/binarystream-h">BinaryStream.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
